title: Gender Balance in Alaska and Rhode Island
question_text: Based on the latest U.S. Census count, only $48.0\%$ of Alaskans are female while $51.7\%$ of Rhode Islanders are female. What is the probability that randomly chosen samples of $50\text{ residents}$ from each of the two states would show a larger proportion of women in Alaska than in Rhode Island?

choices.text: Since we know the true proportion of women in Rhode Island is greater than the true proportion of women in Alaska, it is not possible for a randomly selected sample from each state to show a larger proportion of women in Alaska.
